meta-model.name: All-In-One CMCC Geology Model
meta-model.description: Extends Physics and Chemistry to handle minerals, rock formations, tectonic plates, etc.

meta.title: Geology ToE Meta-Model
meta.subtitle: A Declarative Data Architecture for Minerals, Rock Formations, and Tectonic Processes
meta.abstract: This Geology extension of the CMCC (Conceptual Model Completeness Conjecture) encodes geological structures and processes—minerals, rock layers, tectonic plates—into a unified, Snapshot-Consistent schema. By leveraging the same core primitives (Schema, Data, Lookups, Aggregations, Lambdas), it provides a purely declarative framework for representing everything from mineral compositions and formation data to large-scale tectonic dynamics, tightly integrating with CMCC Physics and Chemistry for cross-domain geological modeling.

key_points: Formalizes geological entities (e.g., mineral records, rock formations, tectonic plates) through aggregator-based logic and constraints.
Bridges physical and chemical processes—like metamorphism or weathering—to the broader CMCC environment, allowing cross-domain synergy.
Remains Turing-complete: advanced geological simulations (e.g., plate tectonic evolution or geochemical cycle modeling) can be expressed declaratively.
Stores field data, measurement logs, and interpretive rules in a single Snapshot-Consistent data substrate, eliminating specialized external scripts.
implications: Simplifies geoscience data pipelines by unifying references to chemical composition, historical climate data, or seismic observations in one schema.
Increases reproducibility and collaboration: geological 'theories' (e.g., plate boundary models) become aggregator constraints, easily shareable with other domains like Astronomy or Biology.
Facilitates advanced cross-disciplinary insights—e.g., linking isotopic data (Chemistry) to tectonic uplift rates (Geology) and climate modeling in the same environment.

narrative.title: CMCC Geology Extension
content: Geology spans from small-scale mineral compositions and crystal structures to continental-scale tectonics and planetary-scale geological cycles. Traditionally, these areas are handled by multiple disconnected tools, making integrated analysis difficult.

The CMCC Geology Model unifies such data: minerals reference chemical aggregator formulas, rock formations track layered compositions, and tectonic plate interactions rely on aggregator-based constraints for motion or stress. Because it is Turing-complete and purely declarative, researchers can add new interpretive logic (like metamorphic phase rules or volcanic activity triggers) as data, without rewriting specialized scripts. Meanwhile, synergy with CMCC Physics or Astronomy allows geoscientists to tie planetary geology directly to cosmic processes, or incorporate gravitational aggregator checks seamlessly.

entities.name: Mineral
entities.description: Basic mineral with chemical composition, crystal structure, etc.

aggregations.name: is_silicate
aggregations.description: Checks if chemical formula suggests a silicate mineral.
aggregations.formula: IF CONTAINS(chemical_formula, 'Si') THEN true ELSE false

aggregations.name: common_rock_forming
aggregations.description: Checks if hardness is > 2.5 and formula has common rock-forming elements (rough heuristic).
aggregations.formula: IF (hardness_mohs > 2.5 AND (CONTAINS(chemical_formula,'Si') OR CONTAINS(chemical_formula,'Al'))) THEN true ELSE false

aggregations.name: hardness_category
aggregations.description: Categorizes hardness into 'very hard' (>=7), 'hard' (4-7), 'soft' (<4).
aggregations.formula: IF hardness_mohs >= 7 THEN 'very hard' ELSE IF hardness_mohs >=4 THEN 'hard' ELSE 'soft'

aggregations.name: carbonate_check
aggregations.description: Returns true if the formula includes CO3, typical of carbonate minerals.
aggregations.formula: IF CONTAINS(chemical_formula, 'CO3') THEN true ELSE false

entities.name: RockFormation
entities.description: A body of rock with one or more minerals, geologic age, etc.

lookups.name: minerals_in_formation
lookups.description: Bridging to list which minerals appear

aggregations.name: num_mineral_types
aggregations.description: Number of distinct minerals in this rock formation.

aggregations.name: dominant_mineral
aggregations.description: Identifies the mineral with the highest percentage_estimate in this formation.

aggregations.name: calcite_content_percent
aggregations.description: Sum of calcite percentage in this formation if present.

aggregations.name: average_mohs_hardness
aggregations.description: Weighted average hardness of minerals in formation based on percentage_estimate.

aggregations.name: is_fossil_bearing
aggregations.description: Heuristic check if formation is known to contain fossils.
aggregations.formula: IF rock_type = 'sedimentary' AND (some fossil flag available) THEN true ELSE false

entities.name: FormationMineralMapping
entities.description: Bridge many minerals to many rock formations

fields.name: percentage_estimate
fields.note: Approx percentage by volume or mass

aggregations.name: relative_hardness_factor
aggregations.description: Partial contribution to hardness based on percentage and the mineral's Mohs hardness.

entities.name: TectonicPlate
entities.description: Major or minor plate in Earth's lithosphere, referencing geometry if needed.

fields.name: approx_area
fields.note: Area in sq. km or m^2

lookups.name: plate_boundaries
lookups.description: All boundary events that reference this plate

aggregations.name: plate_boundary_count
aggregations.description: Counts how many boundary events this plate is involved in.

aggregations.name: largest_boundary_activity
aggregations.description: Finds the boundary with the highest activity_level (conceptual, treating 'high' > 'moderate' > 'low').

aggregations.name: subduction_count
aggregations.description: Counts how many convergent boundaries this plate has.

aggregations.name: plate_motion_estimate
aggregations.description: Placeholder aggregator referencing geophys data to produce velocity (cm/year).

entities.name: PlateBoundaryEvent
entities.description: Captures interactions between tectonic plates (divergent, convergent, transform).

aggregations.name: boundary_risk_score
aggregations.description: Combines boundary_type + activity_level to yield numeric risk measure. Example logic only.
aggregations.formula: IF boundary_type='convergent' AND activity_level='high' THEN 9 ELSE IF boundary_type='transform' AND activity_level='high' THEN 8 ELSE 3

aggregations.name: plate_overlap_area
aggregations.description: Conceptual aggregator to find overlap or direct contact zone geometry, if known.

aggregations.name: is_subduction_zone
aggregations.description: Returns true if boundary_type='convergent'.
aggregations.formula: IF boundary_type='convergent' THEN true ELSE false

constraints.name: different_plates
constraints.error_message: Boundary must involve two distinct plates

entities.name: VolcanicSystem
entities.description: Represents a volcanic system, potentially related to a tectonic plate or boundary.

fields.name: system_id
fields.description: Unique ID for the volcanic system.

fields.name: system_name
fields.description: Name or label of the volcano/volcanic system.

fields.name: dominant_plate_id
fields.description: Which plate this volcanic system is most associated with.

fields.name: recent_eruption_dates
fields.description: Array/list of date/timestamps or year markers for recent eruptions.

fields.name: avg_magma_composition
fields.description: String label for typical magma type (basaltic, andesitic, etc.).

aggregations.name: eruption_frequency
aggregations.description: Counts how many eruption entries are listed in recent_eruption_dates within some time range.

aggregations.name: dominant_magma_type
aggregations.description: Interprets avg_magma_composition to classify the magma (basaltic, andesitic, etc.).

aggregations.name: volcanic_explosivity_index_estimate
aggregations.description: Heuristic aggregator referencing known eruption volumes or historical data to estimate VEI.

aggregations.name: tectonic_association
aggregations.description: Checks if the associated plate is at a convergent boundary or hotspot, etc.

aggregations.name: average_eruption_interval
aggregations.description: Computes average time gap between consecutive eruptions in recent_eruption_dates.

entities.name: EarthquakeRecord
entities.description: Logs a seismic event, potentially referencing plate boundaries, magnitude, depth, etc.

fields.name: eq_id
fields.description: Unique ID for the earthquake record.

fields.name: boundary_event_id
fields.description: Which plate boundary event (if any) this earthquake is associated with.

fields.name: magnitude
fields.description: Earthquake magnitude on a recognized scale, e.g. Mw (moment magnitude).

fields.name: depth_km
fields.description: Focal depth of the quake in kilometers.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Any extra commentary or contextual info.

aggregations.name: energy_release
aggregations.description: Estimates total seismic energy in Joules from magnitude (conceptual formula).

aggregations.name: shallow_or_deep
aggregations.description: Classifies quake depth as 'shallow' (<70 km), 'intermediate' (<300 km), or 'deep' (>=300 km).
aggregations.formula: IF depth_km < 70 THEN 'shallow' ELSE IF depth_km < 300 THEN 'intermediate' ELSE 'deep'

aggregations.name: aftershock_probability
aggregations.description: A heuristic aggregator returning a rough probability of significant aftershocks based on magnitude.

entities.name: AdvancedGeologyRecord
entities.description: Integrates data from multiple geology domains (plates, formations, minerals, etc.) to compute advanced cross-cutting inferences.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this advanced geology record.

fields.name: record_label
fields.description: Human-friendly label for this advanced record or region.

fields.name: plate_ids
fields.description: List of TectonicPlate IDs relevant to this advanced record.

fields.name: formation_ids
fields.description: List of RockFormation IDs in this region or scenario.

fields.name: volcanic_system_ids
fields.description: List of VolcanicSystem IDs, if any.

fields.name: mineral_ids
fields.description: List of Mineral IDs relevant to the region.

fields.name: earthquake_ids
fields.description: List of EarthquakeRecord IDs referencing local seismic events.

aggregations.name: mineral_weathering_index
aggregations.description: Aggregates presence of easily weathered minerals (e.g., calcite) plus environment parameters to produce a weathering index.

aggregations.name: metamorphic_grade_inference
aggregations.description: Estimates metamorphic grade from known index minerals (garnet, kyanite, etc.) in relevant formations.

aggregations.name: subduction_zone_volcanicity_potential
aggregations.description: Checks if any plate boundary among plate_ids is convergent and correlates with known volcanic systems.
aggregations.formula: IF EXISTS(subduction boundary) AND volcanic_system_ids != [] THEN HIGH ELSE LOW

aggregations.name: transform_fault_earthquake_rate_prediction
aggregations.description: Predicts quake frequency if there's a transform boundary in plate_ids plus past quake logs.

aggregations.name: plate_boundary_conflict_risk
aggregations.description: Aggregates boundary risk scores from plate boundaries in plate_ids to produce an overall conflict risk factor.
aggregations.formula: AGGREGATE(PlateBoundaryEvent.boundary_risk_score for each boundary in plate_ids) / COUNT(plate_ids)

aggregations.name: overburden_pressure_estimate
aggregations.description: Heuristic calculation of lithostatic pressure for deeper formations in this region.

aggregations.name: sediment_compaction_factor
aggregations.description: Estimates compaction of sedimentary layers given thickness and time data from relevant formations.

aggregations.name: fossil_preservation_likelihood
aggregations.description: If rock_type='sedimentary' and environment is stable, returns a higher preservation likelihood.

aggregations.name: limestone_dissolution_risk
aggregations.description: Looks for carbonate-rich formations plus acidic conditions to gauge dissolution (karst) risk.

aggregations.name: shock_metamorphism_indicator
aggregations.description: Searches for evidence of meteor impacts or high-pressure minerals in region.

aggregations.name: geothermal_gradient_estimator
aggregations.description: Approximates geothermal gradient from local volcanic data or deep well logs if present.

aggregations.name: volcanic_gas_emission_rate
aggregations.description: Combines volcanic system eruption frequency and average composition to guess gas emission rate.

aggregations.name: hotspot_trace_age_inference
aggregations.description: If region includes a hotspot chain, estimates the age progression along that chain.

aggregations.name: earthquake_recurrence_interval
aggregations.description: A simple average recurrence period for moderate+ quakes in this region.

aggregations.name: plate_motion_direction
aggregations.description: Derives net motion vector from plate_motion_estimate of each TectonicPlate in plate_ids.

aggregations.name: mineral_stability_field
aggregations.description: Checks T/P conditions vs. known stable fields for minerals present in region.

aggregations.name: regional_lithology_mix
aggregations.description: Tallies how many formations are igneous vs sedimentary vs metamorphic, producing a mix ratio.

aggregations.name: rock_deformation_mode_inference
aggregations.description: Summarizes local stress/strain data from boundary types and quake mechanisms.

aggregations.name: plate_boundary_suture_zone_complexity
aggregations.description: Examines if region has collided plates historically, indicating complex suture zones.

aggregations.name: oceanic_crust_spreading_index
aggregations.description: If region includes mid-ocean ridges, estimates local spreading rate or index.

aggregations.name: continental_rift_activity_flag
aggregations.description: Detects if region is in an active rift zone by boundary data plus quake patterns.

aggregations.name: orogenic_belt_evolution_stage
aggregations.description: Estimates orogeny stage (early, peak, declining) from uplift rates, metamorphic grade, etc.

aggregations.name: sedimentary_basin_subsidence_rate
aggregations.description: Calculates how fast a sedimentary basin is sinking, referencing thickness/time or well data.

aggregations.name: tectonic_stress_regime
aggregations.description: Aggregates quake focal mechanisms, boundary types, plate motions to classify stress (compression, extension, strike-slip).

aggregations.name: major_igneous_intrusion_probability
aggregations.description: Checks tectonic setting plus history of pluton/batholith formation to guess chance of large new intrusion.

Mineral.notes: One of the most common minerals in Earth's crust

EarthquakeRecord.notes: Moderate quake along the San Andreas
